snippet: While some leaders argued that the party must find new ways to talk about key issues, others blamed losses on poor candidates.
abstract: Election results have set stage for struggle within Republican Party by exposing its vulnerability to potent demographic shifts; party's first challenge seems to be to find common ground in diagnosing its problems.

byline.original: By KEVIN SACK and SARAH WHEATON

lead_paragraph: While some leaders argued that the party must find new ways to talk about key issues, others blamed losses on poor candidates.

headline.seo: First, Republicans Must Find Common Ground Among Themselves
headline.main: G.O.P. Strains to Define How to Close Gap With Voters
headline.print_headline: Republicans’ First Challenge: Find Common Ground Among Themselves
